sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"管理，支配"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: control, direct, govern, manage, rule, supervise, administer
means: control ： 含义广泛的常用词，指对人或物施以约束或控制的力量。
direct ： 侧重行使领导或指导权。
govern ： 侧重指运用任何控制的权力来统治或管理一个国家、一个社会或一个部门，暗含能力和知识的运用。
manage ： 强调对具体事务机构进行管理，有时含受权管理或处理之意。
rule ： 强调用绝对或独裁的权力来管理或统治。
supervise ： 侧重指运用本身的或被授予的权力来管理、检查工作，含监督意味。
administer ： 指官方的或正式的对事务的管理。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或短语动词都含有"处理，对付"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: deal with, cope with, dispose of, manage, handle
means: deal with ： 既可指处理具体事情，也可指处理或解决具有抽象意义的问题。
cope with ： 指成功地处理或对付更为重大，更为严重的问题或事物。
dispose of与deal with同义，普通用法。
manage ： 指处理日常事务与工作，也可指经营管理。
handle ： 从原义"手柄"，转引申为作"处理"解时，其内涵是管理和操纵。

expand_knowledge_list.cn: 经理：the general manager 总经理

entry.def: If you manage an organization, business, or system, or the people who work in it, you are responsible for controlling them.

example.ex: Within two years he was managing the store...
example.tran: 不出两年他就开始管理这家店了。

example.ex: Most factories in the area are obsolete and badly managed...
example.tran: 这个地区的绝大多数工厂都十分陈旧，经营状况也非常糟糕。

entry.def: If you manage time, money, or other resources, you deal with them carefully and do not waste them.
entry.tran: 谨慎地使用，好好地利用(时间、金钱等)

example.ex: In a busy world, managing your time is increasingly important...
example.tran: 在忙碌的世界里，善于利用时间变得越来越重要。

example.ex: Josh expects me to manage all the household expenses on very little.
example.tran: 乔希指望我对每笔家庭支出都精打细算。

entry.def: If you manage to do something, especially something difficult, you succeed in doing it.

example.ex: Somehow, he'd managed to persuade Kay to buy one for him...
example.tran: 不知用了什么方法，他成功说服凯给他买了一个。

example.ex: I managed to pull myself up onto a wet, sloping ledge...
example.tran: 我终于爬上了一块潮湿倾斜的暗礁。

entry.def: If you manage, you succeed in coping with a difficult situation.

example.ex: She had managed perfectly well without medication for three years...
example.tran: 3年来，她一直没有服药却挺了过来。

example.ex: I am managing, but I could not possibly give up work...
example.tran: 我正在努力应付，但我不可能放弃工作。

entry.def: If you say that you can manage an amount of time or money for something, you mean that you can afford to spend that time or money on it.
entry.tran: 抽出，腾出，安排出(时间、金钱等)

example.ex: This makes it ideal for those who can only manage a few hours in the morning or evening...
example.tran: 对于那些只能在早晚抽出几个小时的人来说，这是最理想不过的了。

example.ex: 'All right, I can manage a fiver,' McMinn said with reluctance.
example.tran: 麦克明不情愿地说：“好吧，我可以出5镑。”

entry.def: If you say that someone managed a particular response, such as a laugh or a greeting, you mean that it was difficult for them to do it because they were feeling sad or upset.
entry.tran: 勉强做出（微笑、寒暄等);强作

example.ex: He looked dazed as he spoke to reporters, managing only a weak smile...
example.tran: 跟记者谈话的时候，他只是勉强挤出一丝淡淡的微笑，显得非常恍惚。

example.ex: He managed a few sentences about his visit to the prison...
example.tran: 他勉强描述了一下探监情况。

entry.def: You say 'I can manage' or 'I'll manage' as a way of refusing someone's offer of help and insisting on doing something by yourself.
entry.tran: （对他人给予帮助的婉拒）我能对付，我能行

example.ex: I know you mean well, but I can manage by myself...
example.tran: 我知道您是一番好意，不过我一个人能行。

example.ex: 'I'll do it, Eleanor,' Angus said, quickly jumping up. But this time she only shook her head. 'I'll manage,' she said firmly.
example.tran: 安格斯一跃而起道：“让我来，埃莉诺。”可是，这一次她只是摇了摇头，坚定地说：“我能应付。”

sentences.sentence: "I managed to carry the box upstairs"
"She pulled it off, even though we never thought her capable of it"

means.word_mean: 2. be in charge of, act on, or dispose of;

sentences.sentence: "I can deal with this crew of workers"
"She managed her parents' affairs after they got too old"

means.word_mean: 3. come to terms or deal successfully with;

sentences.sentence: "We got by on just a gallon of gas"
"They made do on half a loaf of bread every day"

means.word_mean: 5. achieve something by means of trickery or devious methods

sentences.sentence: "We could do with a little more help around here"

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'put (a horse) through the paces of the manège'): from Italian maneggiare, based on Latin manus 'hand'

sentences.cn: 但是，比起如何更好地管理团队，组织机构需要学习一些更重要的事：他们需要不断追问自己，团队合作是否是完成这项工作的最佳途径。

Sentence.sentence: The least that can be concluded from this research is that companies need to think harder about managing teams.
That's why leaders continue to manage the present while building toward the big changes of the future.
Profound changes in the workforce are making teams trickier to manage.
People rarely manage to quit the first time they try.
Members of poorly managed teams are easily distracted from their work.

Loosely managed teams can become hotbeds of distraction—employees routinely complain that they can't get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices.
However, organisations need to learn something bigger than how to manage teams better: they need to be in the habit of asking themselves whether teams are the best tools for the job.
John Nielsen, AAA’s managing director of automotive engineering and repair, said tests suggest drivers may be overestimating their own abilities.
Around 800 A.D., people in Central Asia managed to develop a new kind of carrot—a purple carrot—that attracted more interest from international traders.

Just when you had figured out how to manage fat in your diet, researchers are now warning against another common mealtime pitfall (陷阱) — salt.
But what was perhaps most astonishing about Mr Jobs was the absolute loyalty he managed to inspire in customers.
They feared neither spouse could manage alone.
But Everybody Does It" Most people who get in trouble do know the rules and facts but manage to fool themselves about the risks they're taking by using excuses: "Everyone else does it

The poorly managed state of her house.
